revision.comment: added some more info and a reference
revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2015}} {{BLP sources|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox person |name = Barry Rothbart |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1983|5|25}} |birth_place = [[Forest Hills, NY]], US |image = Barryrothbartwiki.jpg |caption = Rothbart backstage at comedy show |occupation = Comedian, actor, writer |website = {{URL|www.barryrothbart.com}} }} '''Barry Rothbart''' (born May 25, 1983{{citation needed|date=January 2015}}) is an American comedian, actor and writer. He currently splits his time between Los Angeles and New York City. He was named one of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' magazine's "10 Comics to Watch" in 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2013/film/features/how-barry-rothbarts-ad-lib-skills-impressed-scorsese-1200564542/|title=How Barry Rothbart's Ad Lib Skills Impressed Martin Scorsese|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|first=Iain|last=Blair|date=July 17, 2013}}</ref> He played the role of Peter Deblasio in 2013's ''[[The Wolf of Wall Street (2013 film)|The Wolf of Wall Street]]'' and currently plays Kevin on ABC's ''[[Downward Dog (TV series)|Downward Dog]]''.
== Early life == Rothbart was born in Forest Hills in Queens, NY.<ref name="BA">{{cite web|title=BA #240: Barry Rothbart|url=http://boxangeles.com/2018/08/13/ba-240-barry-rothbart/|website=the Box Angeles podcast|date=August 13, 2018}}</ref> Rothbart's father was fired from his job for embezzling money, would later bet his life savings on the Red Sox, losing it all in the [[1986 World Series]], at which his point his mother left his father.<ref name="BA"/> As a result, Rothbart said on [[This Is Not Happening with Ari Shaffir]] that his father was a [[bookie]] for the [[Gambino Crime Family]] but claimed to be a music producer.<ref name="BA"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z0zDGie5jpo|title=This Is Not Happening - Barry Rothbart - Going to Atlantic City with Papa - Uncensored|first=|last=Comedy Central|date=February 13, 2015|publisher=|via=YouTube}}</ref> Rothbart would late do random jobs for his father's illegal sports betting office.<ref name="BA"/>
Rothbart briefly attended [[University of Massachusetts Lowell|UMass Lowell]] and started doing stand up there.<ref name="BA"/> He later transferred to [[Pace University]] to study business, but left there after a year to focus on film at [[Hofstra University]].<ref name="BA"/>
Rothbart would then take classes at [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]] before focusing on stand-up.<ref name="BA"/> After seven years performing around NYC, he decided to move to Los Angeles.<ref name="BA"/>
He is [[Jewish]].<ref>https://twitter.com/barryrothbart/status/62570851157024768</ref>
== Career == Rothbart started out in commercials and found some early success there.<ref name="BA"/>
In 2011, Rothbart made his stand up television debut on ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://splitsider.com/2013/08/talking-to-barry-rothbart/ |title=Talking to Barry Rothbart about Leno|work=[[Splitsider]]|first=Phil|last=Davidson|date=August 27, 2013|accessdate=June 28, 2014}}</ref> In 2013, he was named one of the "Top Ten Comics to Watch" by ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' magazine.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.barryrothbart.com |title=Barry Rothbart |publisher=Barry Rothbart |accessdate=September 5, 2013}}</ref>
In 2012, Rothbart landed a role on the revival of [[Punk'd]] but was fired after four episodes as a result of his management team leaking he had landed the role.<ref name="BA"/>
In 2013 he landed the role of Peter Deblasio in Martin Scorsese's ''[[The Wolf of Wall Street (2013 film)|The Wolf of Wall Street]]''. In June 2014, a show he wrote, ''300 Sunnyside'', was picked up by Comedy Central to air on their fall schedule of that year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/comedy-central-renews-inside-amy-710369 |title=Comedy Central Renews 'Inside Amy Schumer,' Orders Two Series |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first=Lesley|last=Goldberg|date=June 9, 2014|accessdate=June 28, 2014}}</ref> Later that year, he released an album, ''Streets of Fire'', on AST Records.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://splitsider.com/2014/12/keeping-busy-with-barry-rothbart/|title=Keeping Busy with Barry Rothbart|work=[[Splitsider]]|first=Phil|last=Davidson|date=December 1, 2014}}</ref> He later played Kevin in the new ABC comedy ''[[Downward Dog (TV series)|Downward Dog]]''.
==Filmography==
===Films=== *''[[The Wolf of Wall Street (2013 film)|The Wolf of Wall Street]]'' (2013) *''[[Dean (film)|Dean]]'' (2016) *''[[The Happytime Murders|Happytime Murders]]'' (2018)
===Television=== *''[[Men of a Certain Age]]'' (2011) *''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'' (2011) *''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' (2012) *''[[Punk'd]]'' (2012) *''[[tv the half hour]]'' (2012) *''[[Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]]'' (2013) *''[[Adam DeVine's House Party]]'' (2013) *''300 Sunnyside'' (2014) *''[[World's Funniest Fails]]'' (2015) *''[[@midnight]]'' (2015) *''[[Downward Dog (TV series)|Downward Dog]]''
==Discography==
===Albums=== *''Streets of Fire'' (2014)
